item.title: Report E-2024110006
item.description:
Report E-2024110006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: HERCULES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 7, Veolia employees were collecting drums from the customer's site. To create space for additional drums in Veolia's truck, a Veolia employee began stacking empty 55 gallon containers that were already loaded in the truck. The Veolia employee misjudged the weight of one drum, assuming it contained residual waste when it actually weighed approximately 60 pounds. As a result, the drum slipped out of his hands, fell, and was punctured at the bottom when it struck a metal panel attached to the truck. Approximately 1 liter of fluid spilled from the drum. Spill pads were immediately placed to contain the spill and the spill was reported internally to request additional personnel to assist with the cleanup. At approximately 2:30PM (estimate), additional Veolia employees arrived to apply a hydrofluoric acid eater to the spill area along with the necessary PPE for proper management. No spill was released outside of the truck.

item.title: Report I-2024090070
item.description:
Report I-2024090070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T00:41:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRIUMVIRATE ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Carrier picked up load from Shipper between 05:00 and 07:00 with no spilled material observed by Driver or other paries, drive to other scheduled stops which involved multiple loading events with no spills observed by Driver or other parties, load arrived back at home terminal at 11 :49 where it was not handled further until a leak was observed by another Worker at the home terminal at 13:08, spill containment trays deployed, other materials offloaded to access the leaking container which was near the front of the trailer, the container was laid down to stop the leak and to assess the source, container was overpacked, manifest updated, driveway and parking lot inspected for signs of leak which was not observed, concluded based on location of spill and volume that leak had begun shortly before observation, Shipper notified, and load sent to final destination on 09/29/2024 using the same EPA Manifest 017958543FLE. Source of leak found to be small round hole underneath drum; shape of hole was not conducive to damage from the used handling equipment, edges of hole were not pressed inward and not conducive to indication of a puncture, inner rim of the drum's bottom side displayed signs of wear as though metal was aged despite a newer layer of paint. Determined that bottom face had been painted over a weakened surface of the container and that the contents of the drum could have contributed to breaking through paint and an already degraded structural material.

item.title: Report X-2024101435
item.description:
Report X-2024101435

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IAPX 1148 was reported releasing while located in the West Colton rail yard on track 204. The cause of the release was a missing, small, vapor phase valve inside of valve control box. The valve body was found on the floor of the control box. The valve body was reinstalled and secured stopping the release.

item.title: Report E-2024100679
item.description:
Report E-2024100679

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0616 XPO contacted the call center to report a spill in Blythe CA. XPO advised that due to a container failure 1 gallon of Cling No. 153 was released into the trailer floor from a 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of Cling No. 153 released due to the drum lid being defective. The contractors neutralized floor & trailer with Sodium Bicarbonate and overpacked drum to (1) 95-gallon metal drum, neutralized pallet to (1) 55-gallon metal drum, impacted and neutralized PPE and absorbents to (1) 30- gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024101607
item.description:
Report X-2024101607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: Bloomington
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An Engineering crew was working on a track next to track 22 (containing several Marathon Petroleum tank cars) in the West Colton rail yard, when they noticed a smell of propane. It was reported and I was dispatched. The entire cut of tank cars was inspected and CBTX 787961 was found to be leaking from the sample line with a hydrate forming around the plug, the hydrate was rinse off the valve was in the closed position, I attempted to tighten the valve, but it was closed, product is leaking past the valve. As the plug was being removed the release increased and did not slow down. The plug feeling like it may be cross threaded. With no way to address the release a midland kit was applied to the tank car. Tank car is scheduled to be transferred.
